publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3387 Mr Adam Ingram: Treatment for Mild Depression—That the Parliament notes that spending on anti-depressant prescribing is 40% higher in Scotland than in England; recognises that the recent English National Institute for Clinical Excellence guideline on depression found non-pharmacological treatments to be at least as effective as anti-depressants in the treatment of mild depression, and supports the proposal from Depression Alliance Scotland that a SIGN guideline on the non-pharmacological treatment of mild to moderate depression in adults in primary care should be developed for Scotland as a matter of urgency.

S2M-3387 Treatment for Mild Depression (lodged on 4 October 2005) Ms Sandra White*, Tricia Marwick*, John Farquhar Munro*, Rosie Kane*, Richard Lochhead*, Bruce Crawford*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Phil Gallie*, Mr Bruce McFee*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Christine Grahame*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Michael Matheson*, Fiona Hyslop*, Rob Gibson*, Murray Tosh*, Eleanor Scott*, Patrick Harvie*, Brian Adam*, Robin Harper*, Alex Neil*, Shiona Baird*
S2M-3387 Treatment for Mild Depression (lodged on 4 October 2005) Chris Ballance*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Mary Scanlon*

S2M-3387 Mr Adam Ingram: Treatment for Mild Depression—That the Parliament notes that spending on anti-depressant prescribing is 40% higher in Scotland than in England; recognises that the recent English National Institute for Clinical Excellence guideline on depression found non-pharmacological treatments to be at least as effective as anti-depressants in the treatment of mild depression, and supports the proposal from Depression Alliance Scotland that a SIGN guideline on the non-pharmacological treatment of mild to moderate depression in adults in primary care should be developed for Scotland as a matter of urgency. Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Tricia Marwick, John Farquhar Munro, Rosie Kane, Richard Lochhead, Bruce Crawford, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Phil Gallie, Mr Bruce McFee, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Christine Grahame, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Michael Matheson, Fiona Hyslop, Rob Gibson, Murray Tosh, Eleanor Scott, Patrick Harvie, Brian Adam, Robin Harper, Alex Neil, Shiona Baird, Chris Ballance, Mrs Nanette Milne, Dr Elaine Murray, Mary Scanlon, Tommy Sheridan*
